Class BigTwoClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • BigTwoClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CardGame, NetworkGame

    public class BigTwoClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements CardGame, NetworkGame
    The BigTwoClient class is used to model a Big Two card game client. It stores the information of the deck of cards, list of players, list of hands played on the table, the index of the current player, and a console for providing the user interface.

    The implementation of the game can be better presented by the diagram below:

    The detailed heirarchy of classes can be found at the "doc-files" folder

    • Constructor Detail

      • BigTwoClient

        public BigTwoClient()
        The constructor for creating a Big Two card game client. Four players will be initialized and stored into an ArrayList. The console is also created.

      • checkMove

        public void checkMove(int playerID,
                      int[] cardIdx)
        This method is used to check the move made by the current player This method is used when an message is parsed to have a type of MOVE This method also repsonse to the situation where game ends.
        Specified by:
        checkMove in interface CardGame
        Parameters:
        cardIdx - the list of cards selected by the player
        playerID - the playerID of the player who makes the move

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The method for starting a Big Tww card game. One instance of the game is created, and then is started by a shuffle deck of cards.
        Parameters:
        args - This argument will not be used.

      • composeHand

        public static Hand composeHand(CardGamePlayer player,
                               CardList cards)
        The method for returning a valid hand from the list of cards of the player. This method returns null if there is no valid hand. An empty hand, if valid will be returned with type "Pass".
        Parameters:
        player - the player holding a hand of cards
        cards - the cards the player is holding
        Returns:
        a specific hand of cards that is valid for this hand
